name: South Carolina Black Farmers Coalition
description: This coalition is a community of Black farmers, agricultural professionals, and advocates dedicated to advancing the interests of Black farmers in South Carolina. They offer educational programs, training sessions, and workshops to enhance skills and promote sustainable farming practices. They also advocate for policy changes and provide technical assistance and access to grants
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: Fresh Future Farms
description: A nonprofit urban farm and grocery store that provides access to fresh food in underserved communities. They also focus on teaching communities how to grow their own food
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: Freewoods Farm
description: A historic Black farm that operates as a living farm museum, replicating life on small Southern family farms owned and operated by African Americans between 1865-1900. It is now managed by South Carolina State University's 1890 Research and Extension Program
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: Alagogo Organic Farms
description: Grows and sells fruits, microgreens, Nigerian vegetable seeds, sweet potato slips, and other vegetables
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: A & A Farms and Hauling
description: Raises and sells free-ranging, grass-fed and grass-finished Angus beef calves
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: Ashford Family Farms
description: Grows and sells a variety of vegetables, including ethnic greens and other produce
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: A T Williams Farms
description: Grows and sells peanuts, corn, cotton, soybeans, and wheat
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: Bonita's Teas
description: A company featuring products grown on a rural South Carolina farm
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: Joseph Fields Farm
description: A 50-acre organic farm owned by a third-generation farmer
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation

name: Black Farmer Directory (Foundation for Community Impact and Healthy Equity)
description: This directory showcases Black farmers across South Carolina and provides their contact details. You may be able to find individual farms and businesses through this resource. If you are a Black farmer and wish to be featured, you can email info@fcihe.org
services: Black-owned Crop planning in South-Carolina consultation
